paragraph.paragraph: From time to time, as a result to modifications to a project, a compilation will fail. The screenshot below shows the contents of the Output Window following a failed compilation:

In this case, the compilation failed in class ROOT_CLASS during degree 3. This however, does not provide enough explicit information to quickly fix the problem. For more information regarding the error, you need to view the Task List, as demonstrated below:

The current compilation error is listed in the Task List, and if you move the mouse over the error, additional information will appear in the form of a tooltip as in the screenshot above. This tooltip contains detailed information about the error, which simplifies the process of finding and fixing the problem.

If you double click on a compilation error in the Task List, the corresponding source code that caused the compilation to fail, will be opened in an
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/50_The_Eiffel_Editor/index.xml Editor . You can then easily fix the offending code, and recompile the project.
